Prerequisites The only prerequisite is 18.01. If you have already taken 18.310 or 6.046, then you should not take 6.042. See the course on MIT OpenCourseWare for more info at: http://ocw.mit.edu/6-042JF10. Best wishes on your studies!

You've to find the whole sample space, and have a well defined random variable R. Let R = # of flip that results in T. For your case, the sample space S={HHH, HHT, HT, T}, which is NOT uniform. Event (R>1) corresponds to the subset {HHH, HHT, HT}  with a probability of 1/8 + 1/8 + 1/4 = 1/2 Event (R=1) corresponds to the subset {T} , why? Because we defined R to be the # of flip where it results in a T. {T} has a probability of 1/2. I suggest you draw the tree diagram, you'll realise it yourself.

The probability of a random variable taking a value x in range R  is the summation of probabilities of all samples mapped to x. For example, let's say we have 6 sided dice with 1,2,3 each at two sides. Let's denote sides as such 1a, 1b, 2a, 2b, 3a, 3b. Then, the probability of dice outcome to be 1 is equal to the sum of probabilities of all sides with 1, namely, 1a and 1b. So, we need to count all samples mapping to specific value in range.
